result.execSummary:
The defendant Gewitaygabawiqu Gobisage Devlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
2) The defendant shall pay at a rate of $25 per month to probation.
3) If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
The defendant must complete an AODA and comply with any treatment that may be recommended.

1) The defendant shall undergo a mental health evaluation and follow all recommendations.
2) The defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.  
3) The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
The defendant shall not engage in violent or abusive contact with the victim.
The court assessed only the DNA surcharges on Counts 2 and 3, waiving all other court costs in this case.
All conditions of probation listed under Count 2 apply to Count 3 as well.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gewitaygabawiqu Gobisage Devlin

records.addlTxt:
10:29 AM Defendant Gewitaygabawiqu Gobisage Devlin in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Gewitaygabawiqu Gobisage Devlin.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  State assures VR compliance.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Erdman: def pleading to criminal damage to property and disorderly conduct, joint rec for 2 yrs probation; THC 2nd to be DRI.  State moves to amend and remove the repeater enhancers; granted by Court.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas.  Def enters pleas of Guilty.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended Counts 2 and 3 and orders a JOC; Count 1 is DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
2 yrs probation, withheld sentence:
The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Take medications as prescribed. The defendant must complete an AODA and comply with any treatment that may be recommended. Mental health eval and follow through.  No violent or abusive contact with the victim.  $200 DNA only on each count.  $25/month.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gewitaygabawiqu Gobisage Devlin appeared by phone.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Gewitaygabawiqu Gobisage Devlin.  Court makes record RE: schedule and appearances.  Case was set for plea/sentencing, all in-person.  Court addresses defendant.  Atty Erdman updates the Court: def working on programming, offer has been extended and discussed, defense requesting adjournment for 1-2 weeks.  Court explains offer to defendant.  Defendant wishes to proceed with plea; discussion.  Defendant must appear in person.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

No abusive contact with the victim.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No use of any prescription medications without proper prescription.  Defendant must take all prescriptions as prescribed.  Defendant must remain at the Ruth House until further decision of the court.

Physical form sent up to jail for signature 7/26/22.

Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Gewitaygabawiqu Gobisage Devlin. Def appears from Burnett County Jail by Zoom.  Case on for motion hearing on def's bond motion.  Atty Erdman argues in support of motion.  Atty Erdman believes this case will resolve.  Atty Rennicke recites offer- plead to Cts 2 and 3, DRI Ct 1, joint rec for 2 yrs probation.  State assures VR compliance, supplements information on def's housing/transportation needs.  Def makes statement.  Court grants bond motion- amends to signature bond.  No abusive contact with the victim.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Gewitaygabawiqu Gobisage Devlin. Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG pleas to misdemeanors.  Def intends to waive the prelim. Case proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State to file information mirroring complaint.  Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Bond continues.

Def's pro-se request for a bond reduction.
